str:Codelist.com:Name: Code list for concept "Frequency"
str:Codelist.com:Description: This code list provides a set of values indicating the "frequency" of the data (e.g. weekly, monthly, quarterly). The concept "frequency" may refer to various stages in the production process, e.g. data collection or data dissemination. For example, a time series could be disseminated at annual frequency but the underlying data are compiled monthly. The code list is applicable for all different uses of "frequency".

str:Code.com:Name: Annual
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every year

str:Code.com:Name: Biennial
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every two years

str:Code.com:Name: Triennial
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every three years

str:Code.com:Name: Quadrennial
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every four years

str:Code.com:Name: Quinquennial
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every five years

str:Code.com:Name: Decennial
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every ten years

str:Code.com:Name: Bidecennial
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every twenty years

str:Code.com:Name: Tridecennial
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every thirty years

str:Code.com:Name: Three times a year
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated three times a year

str:Code.com:Name: Half-yearly, semester
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every semester

str:Code.com:Name: Quarterly
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every quarter

str:Code.com:Name: Monthly
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every month

str:Code.com:Name: Bimonthly
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every two months

str:Code.com:Name: Semimonthly
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated twice a month

str:Code.com:Name: Three times a month
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated three times a month

str:Code.com:Name: Weekly
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every week

str:Code.com:Name: Biweekly
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every two weeks

str:Code.com:Name: Triweekly
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every three weeks

str:Code.com:Name: Four-weekly
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every four weeks

str:Code.com:Name: Semiweekly
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated twice a week

str:Code.com:Name: Three times a week
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated three times a week

str:Code.com:Name: Daily
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every day

str:Code.com:Name: Twice a day
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated twice a day

str:Code.com:Name: Hourly
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every hour

str:Code.com:Name: Bihourly
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every two hours

str:Code.com:Name: Trihourly
str:Code.com:Description: To be used for data collected or disseminated every three hours

str:Code.com:Name: Daily – business week
str:Code.com:Description: Similar to "daily", however there are no observations for Saturdays and Sundays (so, neither “missing values” nor “numeric values” should be provided for Saturday and Sunday)

str:Code.com:Name: Minutely
str:Code.com:Description: While N denotes "minutely", usually, there may be no observations every minute (for several series the frequency is usually "irregular" within a day/days). And though observations may be sparse (not collected or disseminated every minute), missing values do not need to be given for the minutes when no observations exist: in any case the time stamp determines when an observation is observed

str:Code.com:Name: Irregular
str:Code.com:Description: To be used with irregular time series that stores data for a sequence of arbitrary timepoints. Irregular time series are appropriate when the data arrives unpredictably, such as when the application records every stock trade or when random events are recorded (the interval between each element can be a different length)

str:Code.com:Name: Occasional annual
str:Code.com:Description: The event occurs occasionally with an infrequent update that could span from 1 year to several years between events. It implies a survey that experiences a gap for several years prior to the next survey update (this is commonly linked to funding available to run a specific survey (i.e. health surveys), whereas a regular annual survey refers typically to ‘programs’ that are funded regularly and fall under the Statistics Act, and therefore never experience a gap)

str:Code.com:Name: Occasional monthly
str:Code.com:Description: The event occurs occasionally with an infrequent update that could span from 1 month to several months between events. It implies a survey that experiences a gap for several months prior to the next survey update

str:Code.com:Name: Other
str:Code.com:Description: To be used when the qualitative or quantitative values that a variable takes in a data set is associated to multiple occurrences with frequency other than the already defined ones (for example every 5 hours and 32 minutes etc.)

str:Code.com:Name: Unspecified
str:Code.com:Description: To be used when a set of values are reported within a time range but not associated to sub ranges. Often this could happen in case of missing or sparse information. (Let’s say we have two observations for 2020 but we do not know if they are part of a monthly reporting or quarterly reporting)

str:Code.com:Name: Not applicable
str:Code.com:Description: To be used when the qualitative or quantitative values that a variable takes in a data set is not associated to multiple occurrences (only single occurrence exists) one can use the _Z as frequency
